defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183> kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded in 1900 by local union delegates representing about 2,000 members in cities in the northeastern United States, the ILGWU grew in geographical scope, membership size, political influence to become one of the most powerful forces in American organized labor by mid-century. Representing workers in the women's garment industry, the ILGWU worked to improve working and living conditions of its members through collective bargaining agreements, training programs, health care facilities, cooperative housing, educational opportunities, and other efforts. In 1995, the ILGWU merged with the Amalgamated Clothing and Textile Workers Union (ACTWU) to form the Union of Needletrades, Industrial and Textile Employees (UNITE).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains video recordings, audio recordings, motion picture film, microfilm, and film strips collected, produced or otherwise created by the ILGWU. Among these are 3 DVD copies of 16mm film that document the celebration of the Union Health Center's 50th Anniversary in 1964. In addition to ILGWU members, staff, and officers, the event includes an address by President Lyndon B. Johnson.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: September 28; Sandy Meiser(?) introduces Sol Chaikin. Chaikin talks about height of ILGWU membership in 1969, when it had 460,000 members; talks about growing disparity between the "haves" and "have-nots"; calls Jimmy Carter most helpful president to the ILGWU since John F. Kennedy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: September 28; Attacks Senator Heinz (PA); supports Carter in 1980, saying he is not perfect but is the best option; compares Reagan to Jesse Helms, Orrin Hatch; talks about continuing education opportunities for ILGWU members, including scholarships for members' children

did.unittitle: End of remarks by Chaikin. Announcements by General-Secretary of the Convention

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: September 28; Support for ERA and Carter/Mondale 1980. Chaikin introduces Carter. Carter declares US support for Israel at the UN; differentiates between Democratic and Republican political philosophies, gives his support to ERA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: September 28; He defends legal right to organize, collective bargaining. Sol Chaikin speaks again.

did.unittitle: Footage of Carters limo arrival, waving to crowd; cuts to inside convention hall, but no sound; then cuts to convention resolutions (again); returns to Chaikin introducing Carter, and the beginning of Carters speech.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: September 28; first 2 minutes has sound but no picture

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: September 28; Support for ERA and Carter/Mondale 1980. Chaikin introduces Carter. Carter declares US support for Israel at the UN; differentiates between Democratic and Republican political philosophies, gives his support to ERA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: September 28; Starts the same as v 248, but after Carter's speech it cuts to a "Re-Elect President Carter" dinner; speech by Mario Cuomo introduces Felix [?]. Felix distinguishes Carter from Reagan, advocates for Carter even though he says they do not always see eye-to-eye on economic issues.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: September 28; NYS Lieutenant Governor Mario Cuomo introduces Ed Koch. Koch talks about NYC as a microcosm of America, and thanks Carter for helping New York get out of debt in 1978. After Koch, Cuomo introduces Governor Hugh Carey; Carey says "How to win New York" starts with "thinking ethnic." Carey's speech gets cut in the middle, and the video picks up immediately with the Governor introducing the President, who begins speaking; first minute has sound but no picture

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: September 28; Carter talks about reducing dependency on OPEC; Sound quits as Carter leaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: VHS; 120 min.; Same time frame as v11, with stationary camera not focused on speaker or action.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: VHS; 120 min.; Includes Conductor Malcolm Dodd and chorus perform "Roll the Union On," "Look for the Union Label," "We Shall Not Be Moved," "We're Gonna Roll the Imports Back," "Solidarity Forever." Temporary Chairman Nick Benarno Reverend Joseph Howell, Charles "Chick" Perez, President of Browert County AFL-CIO, District President of Florida AFL-CIO, and Director of the Gold Coast Electrical Job Training Committee. ILGWU President Sol Chaikin, Secretary Treasurer Shelley Appleton, Executive Vice President Wilbur Daniels, Executive Vice President Frederick Siems. The General Executive Board Matthew Stonewall, Douglas Levine, Edward Schneider, Cornelius Wall, Sol Hoffman, Mattie Jackson, Clifford Depin, Glenwood Clay, Sol Goldberg, Manuel Gonzalez, Gerald Grossman, Frank Longal, Jay Mazur, Sam Leimeizer, Erwin Solomon, Evy Dubrow, Peter Nadash, Joseph Fisher, Luigi Montenegro, and Ronal Hallman. Chaikin speaks for duration of tape.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: VHS; 120 min.; Chaikin speaks, some overlap with V11. The profile of the union, Canada, Task Forces, leaders, finances, legislation, international trade unions, the members of the Executive Board and their committees.

did.unittitle: Convention, 1983 - Education Committee, Law Committee, Work Standards, officer reports, organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: VHS; 120 min.; Chaikin speaks about retirees and their replacements, and Unity House. Several committee meetings including the Education committee (which discussed Publications of Union Materials in other languages and citizenship education).

did.unittitle: Convention, 1983 - Friday 5/27/83- 5/28/83, committees - resolutions, social and labor, ILGWU Institution and Welfare, and International Affairs committees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: VHS; 120 min.; Resolutions committee discusses abortion and civil rights. Social and Labor Legislation Committee chaired Evy Dubrow discussing Blue-Cross health care, sick benefits, Citizens' Utility Board, and undocumented workers. ILGWU Institution and Welfare committee discuss Health Center and retirement plans. International Affairs discusses solidarity resolutions; May 27, 19/83- May 28, 1983

did.unittitle: Convention, 1983 - New Camera, Monday 5/30/83, Morning Tape #1.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: VHS; 120 min.; Father Lawrence Conway. Reports by Leon Stein (GEB report), Peter Nadash and Gelles Gottier (Credentials), Mattie Jackson and Herbert Dicurtner (Rules), Luigi Montenegro speaks and Shelley Appleton is appointed temporary chair. Volunteer Stipend is discussed at length.

did.unittitle: 1983 Convention-New Camera, Monday 5/30/83, Morning Tape #2, Afternoon Tape #1.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: VHS; 120 min.; Adopting reports. Constitution amendments are passed. Congressmen Claude Pepper speaks on social justice, free trade, American business and social security. Camera does long pans of the banners of the Locals present. Chaikin speaking to Channel 4 News; May 30, 1983

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: VHS; 120 min.; Resolutions Committee Chair VP Jay Mazur, Manager of Local 23-25 addresses political action, exploitation of undocumented workers, solidarity, employment, putting a ceiling on the Regan tax-break, social services, and lowering interest rates to revive the economy. Erwin Solomon of the Pennsylvania Dress Board and Lillian McKitrick with Resolution Committee's report on civil rights (Dr. King's Birthday as a holiday), amnesty for undocumented workers, energy, public transportation, abortion, solidarity, and changing the name of the ILGWU. Tatanabo Usami of Zensin Dome (Japan's AFL). Usami's speech is delivered by assistant Fukuda on Free-World Trade Union, solidarity, and the promotion of welfare between organizations; May 30, 1983

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: VHS; 120 min.; "Look for the Union Label" in multiple languages. Same content as V17 at different angle (speaking delegates are shown); May 30, 1983

did.unittitle: 1983 Convention-Old Camera, Monday 5/30/83, Morning and Afternoon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: VHS; 120 min.; Tracking problem first 2 minutes. Podium in focus for 10 minutes before Chaikin calls meeting. Tracking problem returns at 10 minutes. Same content as V15; May 30, 1983

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: VHS; 120 min.; Rabbi Robert Frazen , Secretary Daniels, Congressmen James Wright , praises Paula Green and Malcolm Dodd for "Look for the Union Label." VP Sol Hoffman speaks on the Reagan administration, reads the preamble to the report. VP Cornelius Wall discusses minimum wage, shortage of low and middle income housing. Shelley Appleton reads Report of Finances including strike relief and the publication of ILGWU materials in other languages. VP Wall discussing price control for petroleum, utility industry safeguards, labor law reform, homework/labor standards/undocumented workers; May 31, 1983

did.unittitle: 1983 Convention-New Camera, Tuesday 5/31/83, Morning Tape #2, Afternoon Tape #1.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: VHS; 120 min.; Congressman James Wright discusses Reagan. Secretary Daniels makes announcements. Chaikin resumes. Negotiation committee changes in the composition of the GEB; May 31, 1983

Evelyn Dubrow announces the Rangel/Moynihan resolutions to imports in US markets. Speaker of the House Thomas P. "Tip" O'Neill, speaks on behalf of the legislation.
